Posted By: Flyheight (1/23/2013 1:58:35 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Hmm... the comparison to [Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm) (which sees plenty of standard play) is actually quite favorable:  
  
[Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm):  
1. Deal extra damage to player  
2. Protect permanents  
3. Deal extra damage - combat trick  
  
Simic Charm:  
1. Deal extra damage - combat trick  
2. Protect permanents  
3. Gain tempo by bouncing a threat  
  
Where [Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm) has really only two functions, protecting and dealing damage, Simic charm can protect just as well, if not better, and damage almost just as well. In addition to that, Simic charm can bounce, which seems to push this one to the better end of the spectrum. This is not to say that [Boros Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Charm) is bad, but maybe that simic charm is underrated, if only slightly.
posts.html:

Where Boros Charm has really only two functions, protecting and dealing damage, Simic charm can protect just as well, if not better, and damage almost just as well. In addition to that, Simic charm can bounce, which seems to push this one to the better end of the spectrum. This is not to say that Boros Charm is bad, but maybe that simic charm is underrated, if only slightly.

Posted By: Purplerooster (1/24/2013 5:43:11 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's not really comparable to [Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon)/[Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth) - it's just far too versatile.   
What good is unsummon when you're 3 damage away from winning or when your opponent is about to destroy your best creature? (okay it can bounce the creature but wouldn't you rather keep it on the field?)   
What good is giant growth when none of your attacks can get through because your opponent has some massive blocker or something like [Fog bank](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fog bank) or when an important artifact is about to be [Smelt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Smelt)ed?
posts.html:
It's not really comparable to Unsummon/Giant Growth - it's just far too versatile.
What good is unsummon when you're 3 damage away from winning or when your opponent is about to destroy your best creature? (okay it can bounce the creature but wouldn't you rather keep it on the field?)
What good is giant growth when none of your attacks can get through because your opponent has some massive blocker or something like Fog bank or when an important artifact is about to be Smelted?

Posted By: bowlofgumbo (3/26/2013 12:25:07 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This one comes close to [Dimir Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dimir Charm) as my favorite charm. It does everything you want to do and has crazy good flexibility. [Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth) has never been a bad card. Saving your team from board wipe, or simply your best man from removal is great. But that third ability is what makes it. You can use it both defensively and offensively. Sure, bounce one of their threats, but you can also use it to give [Prime Speaker Zegana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prime Speaker Zegana) a second wind if you need it/ feel greedy. Great card. 5/5
posts.html:
